Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.pages

Class PageManager

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.pages.PageManager
public class PageManager extends Object
The Page Manager is a singleton class that manages what page the test is on. Calling setPage with a strong containing the name of the new page calls the Page Factory to create the new page and return it as a Page Object.

  • Method Details

    • driver

      protected static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver()

    • setPage

      public static Page setPage​(String pageName)
      This method sets a Page Object based on the class name passed to it. This allows us to operate on pages without knowing they exist when we write step definitions.

      NOTE: This function is currently only intended for generic step definitions, as it makes the code complex to write otherwise.

      Parameters:
      pageName - String Must be an exact string match (including case) to the Page Object name (e.g. LoginPage).
      Returns:
      Page Returns a reference to the page in case you want to use it immediately.

    • getPage

      public static Page getPage()
      This method returns the current Page Object stored in the Page Manager.
      Returns:
      Page the Page Object

    • openPage

      public static String openPage​(String pageURL)
      Open the URL passed, set the parent window handle and return it.
      Parameters:
      pageURL - String url to open
      Returns:
      String WebDriver handle identifying string - unique for a window and for each tab.

    • open

      protected static void open​(String url)
      Opens up the URL passed to it.

      TO DO: Return a page object of the page we are on now.

      Parameters:
      url - String Full URL to navigate to.

    • quit

      @Deprecated public static void quit()
      Deprecated.
      use WebDriverFactory.quit() instead.
      Quits the current driver. Subsequent calls to the driver will fail. Should be used at the end of tests only.

    • navigateForward

      public static Page navigateForward()
      Emulate clicking the browser's forward button.

      TO DO: We should be checking the URL to see if we are going to an existing page, and if so, passing that off as the new page object.

      Returns:
      Page the current page object for chaining

    • navigateBack

      public static Page navigateBack()
      Emulate clicking the browser's back button.

      TO DO: We should be checking the URL to see if we are going to an existing page, and if so, passing that off as the new page object.

      Returns:
      Page the current page object for chaining

    • refresh

      public static Page refresh()
      Emulate clicking the browser's refresh button.
      Returns:
      Page the current page object for chaining

    • maximizeWindow

      public Page maximizeWindow()
      Maximizes the browser window. Stores the current window size and position so you can return to the existing settings.
      Returns:
      Page - Returns a page object for chaining.

    • getPageTitle

      public static String getPageTitle()
      Returns the title of the current web page we are on. Useful for debugging and assertions.
      Returns:
      String

    • switchToNewWindow

      public static String switchToNewWindow​(String pageName) throws InterruptedException
      Switches focus of the WebDriver to a new window assuming there was only one before. Finds the handle and passes that to overloaded switchToNewWindow() method

      Preconditions: Expects a new tab or window to have just been opened, and for there to be only two.

      Parameters:
      pageName - the new page name to set the window to so it switches correctly
      Returns:
      String the window handle we are switching to
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if page doesn't load

    • switchToNewWindow

      private static void switchToNewWindow​(String pageName, String index) throws InterruptedException
      Overloads sentinel.pages.PageManager#switchToNewWindow() to accept a window index. Calls original sentinel.pages.PageManager#switchToNewWindow() and passes the index. This will allow for more fine grained control at a later date.
      Parameters:
      pageName - the new page name to set the window to so it switches correctly
      index - String the window to which we want to switch
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if page doesn't load

    • closeChildWindow

      public static String closeChildWindow() throws InterruptedException
      Closes the child window and returns to using the parent window. Used for things like PDFs or links opening in a new tab or window that need to be closed after a test is complete.
      Returns:
      String the handle of the parent window to which we are returning
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if page does not load

    • switchToParentWindow

      public static String switchToParentWindow() throws InterruptedException
      Switches to the parent window without closing the child window.
      Returns:
      String the handle of the parent window to which we are returning
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • switchToIFrame

      public static void switchToIFrame()
      Switches focus of the WebDriver to an iFrame.

    • exitIFrame

      public static void exitIFrame()
      Exits existing iFrame.

    • getCurrentUrl

      public static String getCurrentUrl()
      Gets the URL of the page we are currently on by calling the Page Object which has access to the driver object..
      Returns:
      String the URL of currently active window

    • waitForPageLoad

      public static boolean waitForPageLoad() throws InterruptedException
      Sets page load timeout on web driver instance using the timeout and timeunit values set in the configuration file or on the command line. Then interfaces with isPageLoaded to continually test if a page is loaded until it returns true or times out.
      Returns:
      boolean always returns true, will throw exception if page does not load
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread gets interrupted
      See Also:
      isPageLoaded()

    • isPageLoaded

      private static boolean isPageLoaded()
      Returns true if document.readyState is complete for the current driver, meaning the page has loaded successfully. Uses the driver's pageLoadTimeout setting to throw a TimeoutException if the body element cannot be found on the page.
      Returns:
      boolean true if page has loaded, false if not
